thread.title: TN trust vote: Madras HC seeks video proof
thread.title_full: TN trust vote: Madras HC seeks video proof

title: TN trust vote: Madras HC seeks video proof
text: TN trust vote: Madras HC refuses to pass interim orders on DMK plea, seeks video evidence Feb 22, 2017, 02.53PM IST TNN CHENNAI: The Madras high court on Wednesday refused to pass interim orders on a petition filed by the DMK contesting the passage of a confidence motion moved by the Edappadi K Palaniswami government in the assembly on Saturday.DMK working president and leader of the opposition in the assembly M K Stalin filed a public interest petition seeking directions to authorities to annul the trust vote. The AIADMK won the trust vote after the DMK members were evicted from the House who demanded secret ballot. Senior counsel for M Shanmugasundaram appeared for the DMK.Meanwhile, N L Rajah, counsel for the Advocates Forum for Social Justice, who had filed a similar petition recently, said the AIADMK legislators had been kept in illegal detention at a resort. They had been escorted to the assembly in a surreptitious manner in a bus, said the counsel adding, an FIR had been filed against the chief minister for the alleged illegal detention.Asking both counsels to provide video evidence to prove the claims, the first bench of acting Chief Justice Huluvadi G Ramesh and and Justice R Mahadevan posted the matter for further hearing on Monday.
